status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I'd like the ability to import an AWS specific CloudFormation template into the wizard and have the console perform an automatic refactoring of this, stripping out AWS specified fields (like AMI and instance types) and replacing these with user selected values.

Example workflow:

1) User takes AWS CloudFormation template and imports into Wizard
2) User selects the transplant values (i.e. an EMI instead of AMI)
3) Console outputs transformed CloudFormation template ready for launch
fields.summary: Import AWS CloudFormation templates and auto-modify

comments.body: not MVP, place under GUI CF epic for add-on to 4.2 if we have time.

hi [~dkavanagh], for the bullets, for now please use http://fortawesome.github.io/Font-Awesome/icon/angle-right/ and use $hp-gray-65 for color...if I need to change the icon or color I can always go into your PR and do that easily when I UX review. Thanks!

[~jloza], I've converted to lists with those bullets. I can't remember what we decided on the "Unsupported Items" dialog. Were we going to list the services and put more info under the details, or did we decide to stick with the wireframe as shown?
Hi [~dkavanagh] we ended up deciding to leave that as shown in the wireframe. Keep it all under the details.

random stuff I noticed this morning, be sure to fix: 

* still having trouble with summary update, had to click outside the field to get it to acknowledge something was there
* summary updated but warning didn't re-check when I replaced a template with another with unsupported servcies, had to click outside the field to get it to update

also be aware the bullets are showing up in all lists not just those, so spot-check for that and be sure you didn't unintentionally restyle anything that shouldn't be styled like that (look at the nav bar for example, it's all bulleted now). Every <li> shouldn't have the bullets

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1418

Not sure if you'll get to this before the weekend, but here's trying! :-)

Great job, [~dkavanagh]! A few things:

* The Next button on the general tab does not become available and the template is not loaded until focus leaves the URL field. Weren't you going to put in a delay after typing so that it would wait a second and then enable/validate? Most folks will be copy/pasting into this field and will expect the Next button to be enabled after they paste in. Screenshot attached.
* The summary tab choices are not clearing when I change radio buttons for the template like we discussed. They should clear when you change radio buttons. 
* I selected the basic plus VPC template and got a cloud error? "Cannot read URL (Forbidden)". Screenshot attached. 
* The template seems to be converting imageID to eucaImageID param, but what is displayed int he dropdown choices there does not include the ID, just the platform. I'd like to include both, if we could, ID first, then a pipe, then the platform, if that's possible. Screenshot attached.  
* If an unsupported template is selected, we should clear the URL field when we send them back and disable the Next button, until we add in the ability to edit the template directly from the modal box (which we should do, it would be nice to flag specific lines if we can and allow them to edit and upload the edited one and save it as a sample template if we can, or at least provide location for them so they know where it is. Let's do it in another ticket, may not be time in 4.2).

- The URL timeout is 2 seconds and I confirmed it works in Chrome and FF. I can shorten it if that's too long.  ... and then it stopped working. Switched to keydown as I had to in magic search. Also shortened timeout to 1 second.
 - Clearing summary template and description from summary.
 - For the VPC template, I'd need to see your console log messages. I'm loading that and it's checked into the workspace (or you wouldn't see it on your menu). I wonder if there's some kind of permissions issue?
 - I didn't convert an existing imageID param to eucaImageID. I took their Image reference in the template and added a parameter. I can call that whatever, but prefixed it euca to denote it was one we added, but clearly we can do that differently.
 - I'm now clearing the url field and summary fields if we get an un-supported template.

[~jloza], if you get a chance, take a look again. Not sure eveyrthing is resolved, but kicking it back since we can't really screen-share this week.

Getting there, [~dkavanagh]! Nice job!

The weird error when i selected the Basic + VPC template seems to be gone now, BTW. 

* I tried a template with an unsupported service, and the URL field cleared which is good, but the Next button was still enabled. It should be disabled unless that field contains info. Ideally a valid URL. Screenshot attached. 
* Let's talk more about the added parameter for the provided image. I am not really sure what you mean...what did they provide and what did you add and why? 

Thanks!
Yes, I think I just need to validate input after clearing the fields and the next button will disable.

I fixed the validation so that next is now disabled.

The imageID thing.. I changed it to read "ImageId" (removed the Euca).
What's happening is that the template refers to an AMI ID embedded in the template via a map. That makes the template specific to an AWS region. What I do is detect this and convert it to use a parameter (which I need to add to the template). So, I can name that anyway we like. I didn't know if we should specially indicate we added it, but perhaps not.

Hi [~dkavanagh], OK...but also if you look at the screenshot up there the imageID label was associated with a field that was not displaying image IDs. It shows a list of platforms. That is a big part of my concern...shouldn't it be displaying image IDs instead (probably in a chosen with search)?

Hi [~dkavanagh], now that I know those are names and not OSes, we should go ahead and do those like <name (ID)> like we do. Also, there may be a lot of images, it would be good if that Chosen had the search turned on. [DONE]

And, can you ooch things over to the left so that the labels and help bubbles don't wrap? It looks like there's plenty of room with padding and margins etc to make that not wrap. Might need to be global change. CC: [~kgill] [DONE]

Also, modal needs warning icon in title bar. fa-exclamation-triangle, [~kgill] can tell you the orange-ish hex color value we've used for this for better contrast. [DONE]
GUI-1637 branch has been updated

I never said I'd turn on for images. I said I'd turn on for 10 or more items, which is what we discussed. I saw instance types working, perhaps there's a race condition w/ angular and angular-chosen. I did check my work. :-P
I see your screen shot, so I'll look into that instance types issue. I attached a screen shot that shows it working, which is why I pushed for review. I'd never knowingly submit something broken, pls give me the benefit of the doubt.
Just attached chrome-screenshot as well, but as I said, I'll try reproducing and get back to you.

I've fixed up the lists in the aws dialogs to only show if there are values.
I've just seen the instancetype being empty. Inspection shows the chosen never added the options, but the options are on the select built by angular. May need a chosen update call in a short timeout function. (we're seeing this exact problem: https://github.com/localytics/angular-chosen/issues/106)
I believe i've fixed the issues.

hi [~dkavanagh], can you plz turn on search in Chosen for images all the time, regardless of number of items? That seems one place where people will be likely to be looking for one specific thing, and may have c/p'ed it.
image will always use chosen now

Almost there! I see the search on the image, thanks!

"select an option" should not be a selectable option. It should disappear when the options are shown and reappear as watermark text (lighter gray than actual text, use the label value and this can be set globally for all watermark text) if the user closes the chosen without selecting (like if they click outside).
UX review passed, nice job [~dkavanagh]! Ready for code review.
PR 1418 merged

Verified.  This is working.  I tested it with a few AWS templates from amazon's website.
{code}
[root@euca-10-111-75-202 ~]# rpm -qi eucaconsole
Name        : eucaconsole                  Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.1.1                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.6908.463.20150716git654b391.el6   Build Date: Thu 16 Jul 2015 01:00:16 PM UTC
Install Date: Thu 16 Jul 2015 05:02:52 PM UTC      Build Host: euca-10-111-54-133

Size        : 18554944                         License: BSD and MIT and OFL
{code}

I have a template in S3 which is both a Eucalyptus and AWS compatible one. The wizard keeps wanting to convert it when it doesn't need conversion. It seems like if we use an S3 URL to upload a template to the console we always assume its an AWS template?
[~dkavanagh], should we kick this ticket back for you to have a look based on [~lwade]'s comment?
Of course. I'll need more details [~lwade]. I'd like to understand what it is about the template that we're mis-interpreting. We don't specifically try to detect an S3 URL at this point.
Attaching the sample template we use.

[~lwade], I just tested that template on the GUI-1885 branch (where the additional checking was put in to handle this type of thing) and it works fine. Nothing is flagged and the template can be used. In that branch, we additionally don't check if the template is in the sample templates (either included with the console package or in the user-configured s3 bucket).
setting back to this state since issue raised is fixed in GUI-1885 branch
Released in 4.2
